headline: Why 3D Systems (DDD) Stock Is Up Today
summary: Shares of 3D printing company 3D Systems (NYSE:DDD) jumped 2.9% in the morning session after the stock extended the positive momentum as its joint venture, the National Additive Manufacturing and Innovation Company (NAMI), announced a partnership with aerospace giant Lockheed Martin.

headline: Divergent Technologies secures $2.3 billion valuation in latest fundraise
summary: Divergent Technologies said on Monday it has raised $290 million at a valuation of $2.3 billion, as the additive manufacturing startup scales up to meet growing demand from defense customers. The funding round includes $250 million in equity and $40 million in debt, led by Rochefort Asset Management. Divergent said the proceeds will accelerate construction of its production facilities.

headline: The $2.3 Billion Startup That's 3D-Printing America's Next War Machine
summary: Backed by Lockheed and RTX, Divergent is turning missiles into a venture-scale business--one laser-printed part at a time.
